name: NPR
text:
We get fed a lot of stories about sports as a path for upward social mobility. But the vast majority of sports offered at elite schools cater to mostly white, middle class kids. @OnlyAGameNPR
https://t.co/ffr1Xn1EEq

name: NPR
text: The revelation that Tucker Carlson's top writer had posted racist, sexist and homophobic sentiments online for years has led to renewed scrutiny of the Fox News host's own commentaries. Carlson is set to address the controversy Monday. https://t.co/kXGckPJCk4

name: NPR
text:
George Archer was a pro golfer for nearly 50 years. But it wasn't until after his death in 2005 that his secret was revealed: 

He had dyslexia â€” undiagnosed and untreated. @OnlyAGameNPR
https://t.co/qylfHvfAiF

name: NPR
text: Grammarians are up in arms over dictionaries including "irregardless." The Merriam-Webster dictionary responds: "We do not make the English language, we merely record it." https://t.co/gWfldI0Bka

name: NPR
text:
In 2007, U.S. Border Patrol officers detained 76 Indians at the U.S.-Mexico border. Last year, that number exceeded 7,600. 

U.S. and Indian officials have been trying to figure out why.
https://t.co/vY7rBObClV

name: NPR
text:
Rats are usually eager to help in a crisis, but that urge quickly disappears if they're in the company of passive bystanders, new research finds. 

That's very similar to how humans behave.  
 https://t.co/tg7X8GWWq3

name: NPR
text:
What makes a true apology? What does it mean to make amends for past mistakes? 

This @TedRadioHour: speakers explore how repairing the wrongs of the past is the first step toward healing for the future. https://t.co/dTPqeezuCP
